summary: These are notes from the August 16, 2021 preparation of witness Larry Visoski by AUSAs and defense attorneys for trial testimony. The document records Visoski's review of a photo book, his recollections about Jeffrey Epstein's aircraft, properties, and his professional relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell, including clarifications of his prior statements.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Epstein's longtime pilot being prepared for trial testimony. He is shown photographs and asked about his recollections of Epstein's aircraft, properties, and associates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE'. The document details his ownership of aircraft and properties, and his employment of Visoski.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM'. Described as second in command under Epstein, a frequent flyer of his helicopters, and someone Visoski reported to.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Mentioned as another pilot who flew Jeffrey Epstein's helicopters.

persons.name: AUSA Det.
persons.context: Federal prosecutor present for the witness preparation session.

persons.name: Attorneys McGorty & Giffuni
persons.context: Defense attorneys present for the witness preparation session.

connections.description: Visoski was Epstein's pilot from approximately 1994 through the 2010s.
Visoski reported to Maxwell, who was second in charge under Epstein.
Maxwell was second in command under Epstein and frequently used his aircraft.
Both were pilots who flew Epstein's aircraft.

events.title: Witness Preparation of Larry Visoski
events.description: Larry Visoski is prepared for trial testimony by AUSAs and defense attorneys, reviewing photographs and clarifying his recollections.

events.title: Visoski Begins Flying for Epstein
events.description: Larry Visoski confirms he began flying the G2B aircraft for Jeffrey Epstein around 1994.

events.title: Flight Records Turned Over
events.description: Visoski states all flight records for Epstein's planes from before 1999 were turned over to Epstein's attorney around 2006.

keyFacts: Larry Visoski, Epstein's pilot, identified Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in a photo book shown to him during trial preparation.
Visoski stated that Ghislaine Maxwell was 'second in charge' under Jeffrey Epstein and that he reported to her.
Visoski confirmed that all pre-1999 flight records for Epstein's planes were turned over to Epstein's attorney in approximately 2006.
The document notes that Visoski had to sign confidentiality forms as part of his employment, which he understood prevented him from writing a book about his job.

Visoski provided a timeline for Epstein's acquisition of various properties, including the New York residence (mid-1990s), Palm Beach (early 1990s), New Mexico ranch (1996/late 1990s), Little St. James (2000s), and a Paris apartment (2000s).
